alert.note: Alert for Starr (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 1:14AM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Starr County through 145 AM CDT... At 114 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Rio Grande City Municipal Airport, or over Rio Grande City, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rio Grande City, Roma, Escobares, El Sauz, Garciasville, La Rosita, La Victoria, Los Alvarez, Fort Ringgold County Park and Garceno. This includes US Highway 83 between mile markers 802 and 832. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
